headline.main: Real Culprit in Weight Gain? Look Beyond Pregnancy to Age

docs.lead_paragraph: CONVENTIONAL wisdom says that women gain weight with every baby they have and that their post-pregnancy weight stubbornly remains, a silent reminder of the price they paid for having children. But a new study has found that pregnancy's effects are fairly modest and that most women gain large amounts of weight simply with the passage of years.
